intro: Dasycondylus riedelii, commonly known as the Riedel's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Dasycondylus riedelii is known for its ability to store water in its thick stems, allowing it to survive in dry conditions.
